channel.title: Help please
channel.description:
Hi i really need to fix this, when a person is on my server and they click "log out" then for some reason everyone on the server disconnects.. this is what it looks like on the run.bat thing..
Last packet sent to the server was 375 ms ago. at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.createNewIO(Connection.java:2814) at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.(Connection.java:1553) at com.mysql.jdbc.NonRegisteringDriver.connect(NonRegisteringDriver.java :266) at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source) at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source) at SQL.createConnection(SQL.java:14) at SQL.query(SQL.java:31) at SQL.saveHighScore(SQL.java:49) at client.logout(client.java:11457) at PlayerHandler.saveGame(PlayerHandler.java:380) at PlayerHandler.removePlayer(PlayerHandler.java:372) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:286) at process.run(process.java:16) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.lang.NullPointerException at SQL.query(SQL.java:26) at SQL.saveHighScore(SQL.java:49) at client.logout(client.java:11457) at PlayerHandler.saveGame(PlayerHandler.java:380) at PlayerHandler.removePlayer(PlayerHandler.java:372) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:286) at process.run(process.java:16) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.lang.NullPointerException at SQL.destroyConnection(SQL.java:39) at SQL.query(SQL.java:30) at SQL.saveHighScore(SQL.java:50) at client.logout(client.java:11457) at PlayerHandler.saveGame(PlayerHandler.java:380) at PlayerHandler.removePlayer(PlayerHandler.java:372) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:286) at process.run(process.java:16) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) ClientHandler: Rejected persons ip here.CommunicationsException: Communications link failure due to under lying exception:
if you help me fix this i will rep! Info: Airscape Source 317

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

EMINEM BEAST™:

i know i sound like a lazy dumb ass but what if i sent my source to you and you could correct this problem ? :o

No, let me make this even simpler than it already is, go to client.java search for

SQL.createConnection();
SQL.saveHighScore(this);
SQL.destroyConnection();

Then change to this

//SQL.createConnection();
//SQL.saveHighScore(this);
//SQL.destroyConnection();

Then do something about JDBC.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“EMINEM BEAST™, post:7, topic:365872”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=462069.msg3380214#msg3380214 date=1287961523]

i’m sorry I’m such a retard but i cant under stand what your saying? :S

Nevermind, I took the time to download the source my self and check. You have the following codes:

	public void logout() {
SQL.createConnection();
SQL.saveHighScore(this); // hurr durr
SQL.destroyConnection();
		killMyNPCs();
		if(inPitsGame){
		inPitsGame = false;
		PlayerHandler.playersInPit -= 1;
		println_debug(playerName + " resetted pits!");
		}
		resetfollowers();
		savegame(true);
		outStream.createFrame(109);
		//logoutButton = true;
	}
try {
			Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
			con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://localhost/highscores","root","PASSWORD");
			stmt = con.createStatement();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

I think what you need to do is fairly obvious.
[/quote]
replace the top with the bottom? i’m sorry i’m new to coding[/quote]

No, one is connecting to the database (Hence the name Java Database connectivity, JDBC) and one is saying for it to save on logout, this why those people are having this trouble.

You need too;

public void logout() {
//SQL.createConnection(); // annotations
//SQL.saveHighScore(this); // hurr durr
//SQL.destroyConnection(); // annotations
                killMyNPCs();
                if(inPitsGame){
                inPitsGame = false;
                PlayerHandler.playersInPit -= 1;
                println_debug(playerName + " resetted pits!");
                }
                resetfollowers();
                savegame(true);
                outStream.createFrame(109);
                //logoutButton = true;
        }

You might also want to do something with JDBC.

Read full topic

	public void logout() {
SQL.createConnection();
SQL.saveHighScore(this); // hurr durr
SQL.destroyConnection();
		killMyNPCs();
		if(inPitsGame){

and when you say find my logout method where would i look for that? and with the sql do you want me to post the whole thing?[/quote]

Pastebin

Pastebin.com - #1 paste tool since 2002!

Pastebin.com is the number one paste tool since 2002. Pastebin is a website where you can store text online for a set period of time.

Sql.java + Initialize, logout + possible a save command of some sort? Some people add that. Also process.

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Find your logout method and paste the code here, also check your process/initialize methods for any sql related saving code. Can I ask what’s in SQL.java? Have you tried to follow that guys highscore creating tutorial recently?

It sounds like you’ve got JDBC connecting to something which either doesn’t exist or with the wrong information, and they you’re calling methods that save the information which JDBC then uses to save into the sql database. But if it cannot connect it can’t get anywhere.

Read full topic
